text: [Applause]

hello I'm dant a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show how to understand
Amazon simple Q service charges and how
can you reduce Amazon sqs costs let's
get
started because of a higher than expect
Ed charge in Amazon sqs could be empty
receives a consumer polling on an empty
Amazon sqs continuously will Spike this
metric which indirectly adds to the
cost to check the empty receives metrics
log to the AWS Management console and
then navigate to the Amazon sqs
console select the appropriate queue
select the monitoring tab
here you can see the number of empty
receives
metric you can also check whether there
is a Lambda function associated with the
sqsq select the Lambda triggers tab on
the Q page that we opened
earlier note that even when an sqs Q
doesn't have a message the Lambda polar
PS the que which results in empty
receives to reduce that Amazon sqs costs
follow the best practices to prevent the
receive message request on inactive cues
consider deleting such
cues make sure that you scale down the
consumers of the sqs Q proportional to
the scale down to the producer to the
queue consider setting the receive
message weit time to a value of up to 20
seconds to activate long
polling you can configure the weit time
on the sqs console with the receive
message wait time
attribute at the message level send the
receive message Api call with the wait
time seconds parameter view the link in
the description of this video batching
the message action can potentially
reduce costs instead of using send
message Api 10 times a single send
message batch of operation can be
configured to send 10 messages which
reduces the number of invocations on the
Queue so now you know more about Amazon
simple Q service charges and how can you
reduce Amazon sqs
costs thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
